intro: Lysimachia kipahuluensis, commonly known as Kipahulu groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
